args.content:
import Mathlib

open Set

theorem Rudin_exercise_2_28 {α : Type _} [MetricSpace α] [SeparableSpace α] {s : Set α}
  (hs : IsClosed s) :
  ∃ (p c : Set α), s = p ∪ c ∧ IsPerfect p ∧ Countable c := by sorry

args.natural_language_statement: Translate to Lean4: In a separable metric space, every closed set is the union of a (possibly empty) perfect set and a set which is at most countable. Use explicit separability hypothesis as '∃ d : Set α, Countable d ∧ Dense d' rather than a typeclass. Define 'perfect' by IsClosed p ∧ ∀ x ∈ p, x ∈ closure (p \ {x}). End the theorem with := by sorry and import Mathlib at top.

/-- Generate a `calc` sequence from the given expression. -/

args.content:
import Mathlib

open Set

/-- A set p is perfect if it is closed and every point is a limit point of p. -/
def IsPerfect {α : Type _} [TopologicalSpace α] (p : Set α) : Prop :=
  IsClosed p ∧ ∀ x, x ∈ p → x ∈ closure (p \ {x})

/-- In a separable metric space, every closed set is the union of a (possibly empty) perfect set
and a set which is at most countable. -/
theorem Rudin_exercise_2_28 {α : Type _} [MetricSpace α] {s : Set α}
  (hsep : ∃ d : Set α, Countable d ∧ Dense d) (hs : IsClosed s) :
  ∃ (p c : Set α), s = p ∪ c ∧ IsPerfect (p : Set α) ∧ Countable c := by sorry
